intro: Oxybasis amurensis, commonly known as the Amur sandwort, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia, including parts of Russia, China, and Korea. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low, spreading growth habit and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Oxybasis amurensis is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
